pageTextData.title: Founded by Dr John S Pemberton
pageTextData.description: The Coca Cola Company is the world's leading manufacturer, marketer and distributor of non-alcoholic beverage concentrates and syrups, and produces nearly 400 brands..

pageTextData.title: Give the Perfect Gift
pageTextData.description: Shop all of our availiable products and order them straight to your door today.

pageTextData.title: Purchase Now
pageTextData.description: Shop all of our availiable products and order them straight to your door today.

pageTextData.title: Coca Cola
pageTextData.subTitle: New York Harbour, 1886
pageTextData.description: It was 1886, John Pemberton, an Atlanta pharmacist, was inspired by simple curiosity. One afternoon, he stirred up a fragrant, caramel-coloured liquid and, when it was done, the mixture was combined with carbonated water and sampled by customers who all agreed - this new drink was something special!

pageTextData.title: Sprite
pageTextData.subTitle: West Germany, 1959
pageTextData.description: First introduced in 1961, crisp, refreshing, clean-tasting Sprite is now the world's leading lemon and lime flavoured soft drink and is sold in more than 190 different countries. Sprite Zero, part of our no sugar Zero range, offers the delicious lemon lime taste of Sprite without the sugar or calories.

pageTextData.title: Dr Pepper
pageTextData.subTitle: Texas, 1885
pageTextData.description: Dr Pepper's unique, sparkling blend of 23 fruit flavours has been around for well over a century and it's still the same, with that distinctive flavour you just can't quite put your tongue on. It was created by Texas pharmacist Charles Alderton in 1885. The distinctive, bold taste of Dr Pepper has been popular ever since.

pageTextData.x3dCreationMethod: This X3D model of the Coca Cola Can has been created in blender and has been exported into X3D using Blender for display online.
pageTextData.title: History of Coca Cola
pageTextData.subTitle: Atlanta Beginnings
pageTextData.description: It was 1886, and in New York Harbour, workers were constructing the Statue of Liberty. Eight hundred miles away, another great American symbol was about to be unveiled. Like many people who change history, John Pemberton, an Atlanta pharmacist, was inspired by simple curiosity. One afternoon, he stirred up a fragrant, caramel-coloured liquid and, when it was done, he carried it a few doors down to Jacobs' Pharmacy. Here, the mixture was combined with carbonated water and sampled by customers who all agreed - this new drink was something special. So Jacobs' Pharmacy put it on sale for five cents (about 3p) a glass.

pageTextData.x3dCreationMethod: This X3D model of the Sprite bottle has been created in blender and has been exported into X3D using Blender for display online.
pageTextData.title: Sprite — Fanta Klare Zitrone
pageTextData.subTitle: First introduced in 1961
pageTextData.description: Crisp, refreshing, clean-tasting Sprite is now the world's leading lemon and lime flavoured soft drink and is sold in more than 190 different countries. Sprite Zero, part of Coca Cola's no sugar Zero range, offers the delicious lemon lime taste of Sprite without the sugar or calories.

pageTextData.x3dCreationMethod: This X3D model of the pepper cup has been created in blender and has been exported into X3D using Blender for display online.
pageTextData.title: Dr Pepper — Liquid Sunshine
pageTextData.subTitle: 23 fruit flavours
pageTextData.description: Dr Pepper's unique, sparkling blend of 23 fruit flavours has been around for well over a century and it's still the same, with that distinctive flavour you just can't quite put your tongue on. It was created by Texas pharmacist Charles Alderton in 1885. He gave a sample of the first ever batch to Wade Morrison, a local shop owner, and Mr Morrison instantly agreed to stock the drink. The distinctive, bold taste of Dr Pepper has been popular ever since.

pageTextData.cocacolaDescription: It was 1886, and in New York Harbour, workers were constructing the Statue of Liberty. Eight hundred miles away, another great American symbol was about to be unveiled. Like many people who change history, John Pemberton, an Atlanta pharmacist, was inspired by simple curiosity. One afternoon, he stirred up a fragrant, caramel-coloured liquid and, when it was done, he carried it a few doors down to Jacobs' Pharmacy. Here, the mixture was combined with carbonated water and sampled by customers who all agreed - this new drink was something special. So Jacobs' Pharmacy put it on sale for five cents (about 3p) a glass.
pageTextData.spriteDescription: Crisp, refreshing, clean-tasting Sprite is now the world's leading lemon and lime flavoured soft drink and is sold in more than 190 different countries. Sprite Zero, part of Coca Cola's no sugar Zero range, offers the delicious lemon lime taste of Sprite without the sugar or calories.
pageTextData.drePepperDescription: Dr Pepper's unique, sparkling blend of 23 fruit flavours has been around for well over a century and it's still the same, with that distinctive flavour you just can't quite put your tongue on. It was created by Texas pharmacist Charles Alderton in 1885. He gave a sample of the first ever batch to Wade Morrison, a local shop owner, and Mr Morrison instantly agreed to stock the drink. The distinctive, bold taste of Dr Pepper has been popular ever since.
